transportAdvice: Guangzhou has an extensive metro network that connects most major tourist areas, shopping districts, and transport hubs, making it the most practical way to get around. Taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available, though walking is generally only practical within specific neighborhoods due to the city's large scale.

weather.description: Cool and mostly dry with occasional overcast skies, light layers are recommended.
Mild but increasingly damp as spring approaches, with occasional drizzle and fog.
Warm and noticeably humid with frequent overcast days and light rain showers.
Warm and wet as the rainy season begins, expect regular afternoon showers.
Hot and very humid with heavy rainfall, the pre-typhoon season brings frequent downpours.
Peak rainy season with intense heat, high humidity, and risk of typhoon-related storms.
Very hot and steamy with continued heavy rain and occasional typhoon influence.
Similar to July with oppressive heat, high humidity, and the highest typhoon risk of the year.
Still hot and humid with significant rainfall, typhoon risk gradually decreasing through the month.
Pleasantly warm with decreasing rain and lower humidity, one of the best months to visit.
Comfortable and mostly dry with mild temperatures, excellent conditions for sightseeing.
Cool and dry with clear skies, the most comfortable and least humid time of year.
